reviews.title: Inn forgot our reservations
reviews.text: Overall our stay at the Fairfield Inn in Bangor, ME was fine, but our first impression of the Inn was certainly memorable. Upon arrival at 11:30pm we were infomed that the hotel did not have any record of our reservations. We made the reservations a week before our stay and were given a confirmation number, however, the desk clerk did not have any record of such a reservation. I was very upset as I thought we would have to either sleep in the car that night or find another hotel, but the Inn did have a room available for us to stay in. I still cannot express how angry I was with this first impression.

On a more positive note, the staff made cookies every afternoon and put them on a plate on the front desk for guests to eat. They were delicious and something one would expect from a bed and breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here Feb 8th when we brought our son to his acceptance day at nearby Univ Me at Orono. Our experiences with Marriott Fairfield beds had all been exceptional until this particular hotel but it was a very late arrival so we probably got the last room available. On the plus side the indoor pool is wonderful as was the typical extensive continental breakfast and the hotel is very conveniently located to I-95 for parents like us who have UMO students.

Alas! No good words for this Smelly Old Hotel
reviews.text: I have to say that I was disappointed with my stay. I felt that with the Mariott name attached to it, The place should be ok. I wouldn't stay again! My son And I were returning home from the Boston area and decided to stay here for the night. The only thing good about the place was the front desk staff! Our room smelled terrible a cross between a backed up sewage problem and mildew. Initally they didn't want to give us another room (only to spray some type of deoderizer) That was just not acceptable. They did switch our room and it was a bit better although the bathroom tiles were all cracked,there were burn marks on the vanity, there was a chunk of paint ripped off the door and the room was old and dated.The bedding was clean but extremely wrinkled. There was supposed to be coffee and tea in the lobby area but the canisters were empty and when it came to the free continental breakfast there were so many people and no seating for them. It was a stand up meal in the lobby for many . We had already checked out or we would have returned to our room to eat our stale breakfast items. I seldom give a bad review but this place is one to which I never plan to return. Both thumbs down!
